Who We Are

ComplexCity lab was created in July 2013 between the 3 Universities of Technology in France (UTBM, UTC, UTT) and Shanghai University. The lab is lead by a binational steering committee and a scientific board.

French board (UT group)

  • Director — MonZen Tzen
  • Coordinator in France — Bruno Bachimont
  • Coordinator in China — Fabien Pfaender

Chinese board (Shanghai University)

  • Director — 万旺根 (Wan WangGen)
  • Coordinator — To be determined

What We Do

  • ComplexCity lab is an incubator for city related project using technology as a catalyst
  • Strategic Foresight for cities-related comprehensive research and international funding opportunities
  • Capture massive digital city data
  • Create & Design city-related visualizations and services
  • Think Tank about Smart Cities in France, Europe and China with interdisciplinary open events
  • Develop and Share methods and tools for Urban Complex-Systems Analysis

Where To Meet Us

CN — Shanghai University, Baoshan Campus,

Our Process

  • 1We develop strategies and a platform for large scale dynamic heterogenous urban data capture (including traditional non digital data) and data high performance / high availability storage. We design simple end-point so that scientist from various disciplines can use them as simply as possible. This makes quantitative and qualitative data available to all our researchers and partners
  • 2We explore massive urban data using a wide range of data science techniques: machine learning (supervised and unsupervised classification), probabilist methods, design methodologies, 3D modeling, geographic and information visualization, language processing, serious gaming. We create methods and tools to be used by all lab partners.
  • 3We use the result of the two previous step to study complex interdisciplinary issues in the city: citizen health awareness, building of a smart green creative sustainable and lovable city, improving car traffic/walking conditions, modelization of places behaviors and characteristics, smart cctv use for security, livability and mobility.
  • 4We design online city services and serious games for citizens, companies and government based on our multi-layered data for them to explore, know better, and improve policies of their city. It also help in return crowd source urban data.

Frequently Asked Questions

  • QIs ComplexCity an official lab?

  • ComplexCity Lab was first created as the Sino-French Insitute of Smart city in 2011 with a Memorandum Od Understanding Between SHU and the UT group. It became an official laboratory the 13rd of July 2013 created by both Shanghai University and the 3 universities of the UT group: Université de Technologie de Belfort-Montbéliard, Université de Technologie de Compiègne, Université de Technologie de Troyes.
    The laboratory is interdisciplinary and is not associated with any specific major field of knowledge. The researchers working with ComplexCity lab usually belongs to another lab and are associated to ComplexCity laboratory.

  • QHow to work with the lab?

  • There is several ways to work with ComplexCity Lab whether your are student, academic or company. As any lab we can offer lab project and lab internship, we can exchange students and researchers, we can organize events together and/or share our data/scientific method with you. Do not hesitate to get in touch with us.

  • QDo you work solely on China and/or Shanghai city?

  • Being a sino-french lab with a platform in Shanghai does not mean we work only on chinese city or on Shanghai. Our researchers do research on many cities in France, China or internationally. We gather data on many cities in the world as well. The choice to gather data or work on a specific city is people driven as the studies of the lab emphasize a deep understanding of the cities only possible by collaborating with people knowing these cities very well (whether sociologist, urbanist, designer, architect or simple citizens).

  • QDo you offer funding for your hosted project?

  • ComplexCity lab cannot offer funding for hosted project. ComplexCity lab can help you to find fund to incubate your project and offer you visibility for it but it only concerns short mobility funding. Researchers are invited to submit their project to their national, bi-national or international call for funding. ComplexCity lab team can also provide a strategic foresight for these funding and any specific China-France funding proposal.

Complexcity Lab is a collaboration between french Université de Technologie Group and Shanghai University
